title: Cross – Organizational Enterprise 2.0 Projects as a door opener for Open Ecosystems

author: Alexander Hochmeier, Upper Austria University of Applied Sciences

segmentation: Welcome to.
Our presentation, as you can see, I'm not alone, so let me introduce introduce ourselves.
This is my colleague did netball and meet Alexander Hoekema.
We are both working as researchers for the Upper Austria University of Applied Scientists and our domain is digital economy.
For the last two years we have been working on a research project called Supply Chain Information Management 2.0.
This is also the background of this presentation.
The main part of this research project is how to connect a company with all its partners inside the value network despite on network violate dimension maybe?
How to increase the intensity of Corporation and the quality of Corporation and.

The company is part in and.
Lots of the companies Dridu.
Meet the demands of generation of knowledge and information and sharing of knowledge and information by investing in ID systems.
For example, enterprise resource planning systems, customer relationship management systems, supplier relationship management, whatever.
But the problem is, all these traditional systems are increasingly incapable of meeting the demands of really sharing the knowledge and the information inside the value network.
And this is the point that leads me to Enterprise 2.0.

We talk about Enterprise 2.0.

Literature you find out that all this technology things this enterprise 2.0 has high potential to meeting the demands I was talking before all this information sharing the knowledge creation and so on and also to support, for example, the innovation process.
Next slide, please.
Also, many companies have discovered the potential of this technology, but speaking about technology enterprise 2.0 is no technology project.

It's much more a social project, cultural change project, 'cause the problem for companies is that all this enterprise 2.0 tools and concepts do not fit together with this classical hierarchical systems and organizations.
Everybody, no matter what Department he's working for, what companies he's working for or she is working for.
Can do whatever he or she wants and there is the fear of losing control inside all these hierarchical organizations and so.
Trying to introduce Enterprise 2.0 Inside a company or in between companies always is a social change project mainly and not a technology driven project.
And this leads me to the term of trust, 'cause making things transparent.
Communicating in this open way, collaborating, no matter what Department you are working in, what company or working in losing control requires a certain level of trust.
Without trust, there will be no cooperation, so the main focus of the next few minutes will be.
How can we do such projects successfully and how can we increase the level of trust?
So next month.
Please.

Having identified trust as the critical success factor of such projects of such change projects, we explored literature and there are many approaches how trust can be established or increased, and one of these approaches we're focusing on is to so-called self reinforcing cycle of trust.

Circle tell us.

Collaborating.

When we take information and place it on a central platform, we make things transparent.
